poem:
In The Likeness of Other Times  

In ink-stained solitude he wrote,  
this godfather of festive pasts,  
while modern voices seek to unearth  
the shadows of a gilded age,  
where Dickens whispers through pod-clad ears,  
his spirit, mingling among the wires,  
reminds us all of time's repeated tale—  
history's breath in digital stories shared.
